message.content:
cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the ethical implications of using machine learning in actuarial risk assessments in the criminal justice system. It touches on issues related to fairness, bias, and predictive accuracy, which are commonly discussed in the fields of computational criminology (cs.CY), computer security and privacy (cs.CR), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and social and information networks (cs.SI). Therefore, these are the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper.
